Message.Title: Dividend vs. Buyback
Message.Msg: Holding many Yahoo shares, and I'm not being negative here, just asking if there has been a definite statement that all of the Alibaba revenue (minus taxes) is going to stock buybacks. At one time, there was talk that perhaps part of it might be in the form of a cash dividend to shareholders. If there was a definite statement, or press release from Yahoo, clarifying any of this, I'd appreciate seeing it. I am now assuming that it will all be spent on buybacks.

Topic.Title: earnings question

Message.Msg: no! yhoo share holders receive no credit for yhoo japan or alibaba. it can only be incorporated into the share price when they are sold. That is the only way they can be montized. alibaba and yahoo japan value are not figured into yhoo share price.

Topic.Title: earnings question

Message.Msg: Yhoo should sell yahoo japan and IPO Alibaba. Cash will be king in the next few years for yhoo. If they increase earnings their stock is the best investment out there for them. Buy back as much of their stock now.
